holidays.name: Mama's Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate and pamper the 'Mama' figures in our lives with love, gratitude, and maybe some homemade cookies.
holidays.origin: Started as an unofficial, heartfelt observance in the mid-20th century to honor mothers' hard work and sacrifices.
holidays.funFact: It's often celebrated with surprise breakfast-in-bed and hand-written notes that tug at the heartstrings.

holidays.name: Thanksgiving Day (Canada)
holidays.description: Canadaâ€™s official Thanksgiving celebration where people give thanks for the harvest and blessings of the past year.
holidays.origin: Originated in the 16th century with European explorer Martin Frobisher holding a formal ceremony of thanks for safe passage.
holidays.funFact: Canadian Thanksgiving always falls on the second Monday of October, but scattered unofficial local observances can take place later like November 26 in some areas.

holidays.name: Shopping Reminder Day
holidays.description: A quirky pre-Black Friday reminder to make a list, set a budget, and avoid impulsive splurges during the holiday shopping season.
holidays.origin: A newer, internet-born quirky observance encouraging mindful shopping behavior.
holidays.funFact: Some people celebrate by breaking out a calculator and planner to prep their holiday shopping strategies.
